title: How is an entrepreneur different from an innovator? - Quora

response.answer_text: Innovatoris the one who introduce new method, ideas, or products.For example, introducing a new equipment that can reduce the electricity consumption by some percentage is an innovation.Innovations need creativity and new thinking. Innovation always does not mean invention. Innovation can create change and add values to the existing product or a service. The sources of innovation are economic changes, technological changes, new knowledge, new markets, etc. These things make a person think of a new product, services or business process. Innovation help organizations to be strong and be competitive in the industry. There is no risk involved in innovation. Entrepreneuris the one who sets up a business or businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.Entrepreneurship understands the business opportunity for the great ideas innovated and adds a tangible value to the innovation. Entrepreneurs always search for innovation sources and they do not restrict themselves for one type of innovation. Entrepreneurs set up business on the opportunity identified and run it profitably. They need skills like planning, decision making, managing planning , motivating and risk taking . Successful entrepreneurship is always a result of hardworking, commitment, and risk taking. Difference between Innovator and EntrepreneurThe key difference between innovation and entrepreneurship is that the innovation means introducing something new. This can be an idea , product, model, or a service. On the other hand, making a great idea into a business opportunity is entrepreneurship. Entrepreneurship begins with innovation. There is a risk involved in entrepreneurship which is not there in innovation. SOURCE-Difference Between Innovation and Entrepreneurship

The article on Allbusiness is a great read if you like to dive deeper into the topic.[1] Innovators are Everywhere Innovators are the ones who have brilliant ideas in the shower; entrepreneurs are the ones who do something about it after coming out of the shower. Entrepreneurs Don’t Need The Best Ideas The best entrepreneurs just need a viable idea. It’s really not a matter of who has the best idea, who contributed the most, or how many awards you won. The major difference between an innovator and an entrepreneur is their passion and persistence. Entrepreneurs stop at nothing to turn their idea into reality. Entrepreneurs Don’t Need to Be Original Entrepreneurs don’t care if their idea happens to be similar to another product or business that is already on the market. Competition is healthy as long as you have the right team to build an amazing product and succeed in the market. Entrepreneurs Need Grit Turning an idea into a viable product or business takes time and effort. Entrepreneurs know the risk of raising funds, securing patents or trademarks, recruiting the wrong people, supply chain issues and manufacturing. Entrepreneurs are Risk-Takers Entrepreneurs are aware of their slim chances of success. They understand the risk that it takes to start and build a business. However, they see a challenge as an opportunity. They thrive on negativity. Every NO makes them stronger.
